Hi Scott,

As far as I understand (I think the developers can add more information) 
by default admin console is deployed with precompiled JSPs located in 
WEB-INF/lib/jsp.jar so when you make changes to pages inside admin.war 
you can't see them after the restart.

You need either download source distribution and rebuild heritrix from 
sources using Maven or edit WEB-INF/web.xml inside admin.war and remove 
everything between comments

<!--
Automatically created by Tomcat JspC.
Place this fragement in the web.xml before all icon, display-name,
description, distributable, and context-param elements.
-->

and

<!--
All session-config, mime-mapping, welcome-file-list, error-page, taglib,
resource-ref, security-constraint, login-config, security-role,
env-entry, and ejb-ref elements should follow this fragment.
-->

I am not quite sure about the reasons why this is done this way, I mean 
why JSPs are precompiled at build time. I am also not sure that we don't 
break anything important editing web.xml. So please use my advice with care.


Regards,
Sergey

> 
> I'm trying to make some changes to the admin console, but I'm not quite 
> sure how to do it. I've tried modifying the files inside 
> webapps/admin.war, but when I restart Heritrix, none of my changes show up.
> 
> Where should I be making the changes?
> 
> Thanks
>
